keyMoments.title: Refuses to Back Down from Duel
keyMoments.description: Despite severe internal injuries from exploding rum, Dorry insists on fighting Brogy to honor their century-long tradition, reconciling with Luffy but refusing to avoid combat.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the unwavering honor code of Elbaf warriors and their commitment to sacred duels regardless of personal cost.
keyMoments.quote: I cannot avoid this fight no matter how injured I am, as my god wills it.

keyMoments.title: Pins Luffy Under Boulder
keyMoments.description: To prevent interference in the sacred duel, Dorry places a massive boulder on Luffy, showing his determination to fight on his own terms.
keyMoments.significance: Illustrates the sanctity of the giants' duel and Dorry's respect for their warrior traditions.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Brogy
keyMoments.description: Due to his internal injuries and Mr. 3's sabotage with slippery wax, Dorry is defeated by Brogy in their 73,466th duel.
keyMoments.significance: First time in their century-long rivalry that one giant truly defeats the other, though the victory is tainted by deception.

relationships.description: Dorry reconciles with Luffy after realizing the Straw Hats didn't sabotage his drink, respecting Luffy's concern for fair combat.

evolutionMoments.description: Dorry forgives Luffy and recognizes the Straw Hats' innocence in the rum sabotage.

keyMoments.title: 73,466th Duel Begins
keyMoments.description: Brogy meets Dorry for their latest battle, unaware of Dorry's severe internal injuries from sabotaged rum.
keyMoments.significance: Continuation of their century-long tradition, though this duel will be corrupted by outside interference.

keyMoments.title: Defeats Dorry
keyMoments.description: Brogy lands a decisive blow on Dorry, winning their duel for the first time due to Dorry's injuries and Mr. 3's interference.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the first conclusive victory in their century-long rivalry, though achieved through deception.

keyMoments.title: Weeps Over Defeated Dorry
keyMoments.description: Brogy stands in tears over Dorry's apparently lifeless body, revealing the deep friendship beneath their endless combat.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that despite fighting for 100 years, the two giants remain close friends with genuine concern for each other.

keyMoments.title: Trapped by Mr. 3's Wax
keyMoments.description: While grieving, Brogy is ambushed by Mr. 3 who encases his feet in iron-hard wax, immobilizing the giant.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the Doru Doru no Mi's power against even giant-sized opponents.

keyMoments.title: Learns of Sabotage
keyMoments.description: Vivi reveals that his victory was achieved through sabotage, devastating Brogy's warrior pride.
keyMoments.significance: Shows how important honor and fair combat are to the Elbaf giants, making Brogy sympathetic despite defeating Dorry.

keyMoments.title: Captures Straw Hats with Wax Duplicates
keyMoments.description: Mr. 3 uses his Doru Doru no Mi to create life-sized wax duplicates of Luffy and other traps to capture Nami and Zoro.
keyMoments.significance: First demonstration of Mr. 3's tactical use of wax to create elaborate traps and deceptions.

keyMoments.title: Sabotages Duel with Wax
keyMoments.description: Mr. 3 creates slippery wax substance under Dorry's foot during the duel, causing him to slip and be defeated by Brogy.
keyMoments.significance: Crucial moment where Mr. 3's interference corrupts the sacred duel, showing his cunning and dishonorable tactics.

keyMoments.title: Traps Brogy in Wax
keyMoments.description: Mr. 3 reveals himself and uses hardened wax to immobilize Brogy, starting to encase the giant's entire body.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the Doru Doru no Mi's restraining capabilities against even the mightiest opponents.

keyMoments.title: Reveals Wax Statue Plan
keyMoments.description: Mr. 3 announces his intention to turn Brogy and the captured Straw Hats into wax statues on a giant candelabra.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals Mr. 3's sadistic artistic nature and establishes the dire threat for the next episode.

keyMoments.title: Doru Doru no Mi Identified
keyMoments.description: Vivi and Mr. 5 identify and explain the properties of the Doru Doru no Mi, noting the hardened wax is as strong as steel.
keyMoments.significance: Provides crucial information about Mr. 3's Devil Fruit and establishes wax properties in the One Piece world.

abilities.description: Mr. 3 can create life-sized wax sculptures that closely resemble real people to set traps.
Mr. 3 can create a slippery liquid wax substance that causes opponents to lose their footing.
Mr. 3 can encase opponents in iron-hard wax that immobilizes them, effective even against giants.

keyMoments.title: Captured by Mr. 5
keyMoments.description: Vivi is captured by Mr. 5 who intends to bring her to Mr. 3.
keyMoments.significance: Raises stakes as the person the Straw Hats are protecting falls into enemy hands.

keyMoments.title: Reveals Sabotage to Brogy
keyMoments.description: Vivi explains to Brogy that his victory was achieved through sabotage with a bomb in Dorry's rum.
keyMoments.significance: Vivi's revelation devastates Brogy's warrior pride and exposes Mr. 3's dishonor.

keyMoments.title: Identifies Doru Doru no Mi
keyMoments.description: Vivi correctly identifies Mr. 3's Devil Fruit as the Doru Doru no Mi.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Vivi's knowledge and analytical abilities regarding Devil Fruits.

keyMoments.title: Tries to Stop Dorry from Fighting
keyMoments.description: Luffy attempts to convince the injured Dorry not to fight Brogy, showing concern for the giant's wellbeing.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's growing maturity and concern for his friends' safety.

keyMoments.title: Pinned Under Boulder
keyMoments.description: Dorry places a massive boulder on Luffy to prevent him from interfering in the sacred duel.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's developing respect for others' convictions, even when he disagrees.

keyMoments.title: Confronts Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine
keyMoments.description: At Dorry's camp, Luffy confronts the Baroque Works agents who attack the group.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up continued conflict with Baroque Works operatives.

keyMoments.title: Captured by Wax Trap
keyMoments.description: Zoro is captured by Mr. 3's elaborate wax traps.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Mr. 3's ability to trap even powerful fighters like Zoro using cunning rather than direct combat.

keyMoments.title: Trapped by Wax Duplicate
keyMoments.description: Nami is distracted by a life-sized wax duplicate of Luffy and captured by Mr. 3's traps.
keyMoments.significance: First demonstration of Mr. 3's deceptive wax duplicate technique.

keyMoments.title: Stomped Into Ground by Miss Valentine
keyMoments.description: Miss Valentine uses her Kilo Kilo no Mi powers to stomp Usopp chest-deep into the ground.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the overwhelming power difference between Usopp and the Baroque Works agents.

keyMoments.title: Attacks Straw Hats at Dorry's Camp
keyMoments.description: Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine assault Luffy, Usopp, and Vivi after defeating Karoo.
keyMoments.significance: Splits the conflict across multiple locations on Little Garden.

keyMoments.title: Kick Bomb Debut
keyMoments.description: Mr. 5 demonstrates his Kick Bomb technique using his Bomu Bomu no Mi.
keyMoments.significance: Expands known abilities of the Bomu Bomu no Mi beyond breath and booger bombs.

keyMoments.title: Captures Vivi
keyMoments.description: Successfully captures Princess Vivi to bring her to Mr. 3.
keyMoments.significance: Achieves Baroque Works' primary objective of capturing the princess.

keyMoments.title: Explains Doru Doru no Mi Properties
keyMoments.description: Mr. 5 provides information about Mr. 3's Devil Fruit, explaining that hardened wax is as strong as steel.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the combat capabilities and limitations of the Doru Doru no Mi.
keyMoments.quote: The wax is as strong as steel when hardened.

abilities.description: Mr. 5 creates explosive kicks using his Bomu Bomu no Mi ability.

keyMoments.title: Attacks Straw Hats
keyMoments.description: Joins Mr. 5 in assaulting the Straw Hats at Dorry's camp.
keyMoments.significance: Part of Baroque Works' coordinated attack on Little Garden.

keyMoments.title: Stomps Usopp Into Ground
keyMoments.description: Uses her Kilo Kilo no Mi powers to increase her weight and stomp Usopp chest-deep into the ground.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the Kilo Kilo no Mi's combat effectiveness.
